CatDescriptText: Ethel Thomas, housewife, 2217 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 15, 1959, pg. B1 with question: "Do you believe judges give society proper protection by refusing to send confessed murderers, guilty of murder in the first degree, to the electric chair?" answer reads: "I couldn't say because I have not heard or read of enough cases. However, I don't believe that every case warrants the electric chair.  There are a few cases where the confessed murderer deserved the electric chair and did not receive it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ethel Thomas wearing light colored sleeveless blouse, and sunglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
